text: I just happened upon this event in Durham on Meetup and am thinking of checking it out tomorrow. The description is a bit vague but it has to do with the Olympics and virtual reality, which sounds cool. It's also low commitment (aka free), so I figure it can't hurt to check it out. If anyone is interested, let me know! <http://www.eventbrite.com/e/courtside-xperience-usa-opening-day-games-vr-sponsors-samsung-att-tickets-26807894133>

attachments.title: Courtside Xperience | USA Opening day games + VR | Sponsors Samsung & AT&T
attachments.text: Come Cheer Team USA in Rio! Watch your hometown favorites work together to bring home the GOLD!!!  Mens Basketball - Duke: Coach Mike Krzyzewski and Kyrie Irving, Carolina: Harrison Barnes  Womens Soccer - Carolina: Crystal Dunn, Whitney Engen, Tobin Heath, Meghan Klingenberg, Allie Long   Courtside Seats Include: Free Admission! Beverages: One (1) free drink ticket Virtual Reality (VR): Xperience some of your favorite Olympic events and athletes up close in 3D Virutal Reality 360° video Olympics: Watch Olympic Ceremony, Watch USA Mens Basketball & Womens Soccer on Big Screen  Speakers: Former Sports Pros will talk about the vision for Courtside X Door Prizes    Show Your Team Spirit:  Attire: Wear your USA Olympic Teams colors or come as you are Fans: Cheer on Team USA and bring a friend!    Location: American Tobacco Campus @ American Underground From Inside American Tobacco Campus: Enter the breezeway doors to the right of Cuban Revolution. Go down the stairwell on the left and walk straight down the hallway. The event will held in the presentation room on the right.    From Outside American Tobacco Campus: Enter the Cuban Revolution doors on Blackwell St. Go downstairs and then take a second set of stairs on the right and walk straight down hallway. The event will be held on the presentation room on the right.      Co-Sponsored By: American Underground, Samsung, AT&T, USports, Raleigh-Durham Sports Tech Meetup, RTPVR, LEVR
attachments.fallback: Eventbrite: Courtside Xperience | USA Opening day games + VR | Sponsors Samsung & AT&T

text: Hey Zack, I can go--watching the Olympics in VR sounds interesting.  ALso, I live around the corner from there.
<@U1KRNTXL5>: Cool. I'll let you know if something comes up and I can no longer go, otherwise see you there!
